alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 13 at 2:36PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...The threat of strong and gusty winds, thunderstorms and flash flooding conditions remain through Friday... Latest satellite imageries show a broad and deep convective cell, about 120 miles southwest of Tutuila moving closer to the territory. This cell is expected to produce strong and gusty winds, increased flash flooding conditions with embedded thunderstorms. Additionally, the South Pacific Convergence Zone (SPCZ) lingers over the islands through the new week. The gust front from the outflow boundary of the aforementioned cell will likely generate near gale force (30 to 35 mph) southwest winds with higher gusts, near thunderstorms, tonight through Friday as the cell nears the islands. Possible impacts from these winds include: risk of unsecured items being blown around, downed tree branches and shallow root trees, possible downed power lines and phone lines, and rough conditions for mariners as well as high surfs for beachgoers, tonight. The threat of flash flooding with embedded thunderstorms has increased for tonight through Friday. Possible impacts from flash flooding include: flooding in flood-prone and low-lying areas, overflowing of streams, possible landslides, and runoffs.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
